comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'd say this pic might have been taken in ca. mid 1886...here we see the David Jones building at the corner of George and Barrack Sts under construction...per the various newspaper reports, the DJ's building appears to have been completed in ca. March 1887...for sources, see the comments accompanying this later pic, which shows the DJ's building completed, but the GPO clock tower still without bells or clock faces - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2554622065/ Maybe the date range can be narrowed further if we can establish when work on the DJ's building commenced. Note that in this pic we see some scaffolding still in place at the GPO. One newspaper report indicates that the scaffolding which had been erected for the construction of the GPO tower was removed by ca. March 1886...so that might be another date marker... UPDATE ... various digitised newspaper hits tend to suggest that construction of the new DJ's building was under way by ca. February 1886...eg see this SMH item re a stone-mason's dispute in column 2 nla.gov.au/nla.news-page1402838 ; so maybe we're looking at ca. Feb-March-April 1886...the early stages of construction. Another wonderful image!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Fantastic thank you! We have updated our records with all this data. More to come from this wonderful album!
